Be a reliable, scalable, trustworth partner to our customers

nodes.name: Unlock the promise of physical computing by reducing friction for fleet owners

Edge computing will be the fourth and largest compute paradigm. Its future will be defined by "fleet owners" building differentiated fleets using linux, containers, PaaS cloud workflows, and SBC-like hardware.

nodes.id: New paradigms require bottom up thinking
nodes.name: New paradigmatic platforms require rethinking from the bottom-up, which is why existing platforms cannot colonise new paradigms
Computing paradigms only take off when they’re opened up to mainstream developers
We’re in a big market, and it’s getting bigger all the time as new entrants arrive
We’re default alive, and there is no other external threat that could kill us if we don’t rush.

nodes.id: Fleet owners will pay for our product
nodes.name: We’re the leader among non-DIY solutions. Still nothing worthwhile from the big players, and startups make interesting attempts but will never catch up. Fleet owners will therefore happily pay for our product.
The IoT market is still growing slowly, although it will eventually take off and we need to have a solid market position when it does

nodes.id: We have enough time to grow with the market.
nodes.name: We have enough time to grow with the market.

nodes.id: Build the org we want to become
nodes.name: The larger you get, the harder it is to change your organisational structure, so we need to put the effort now into building the organisation we want to become
The sorts of leaps we want to make involve product-wide evolution, so per-component teams will not work

nodes.id: Productive work is fulfilling and interesting
nodes.name: People are more productive if their work is fulfilling and interesting

nodes.id: The standard way of running large companies is sub-optimal
nodes.name: We will be large, and the standard way of running large companies stifles innovation and is inefficient and soul destroying
Since there’s no hurry, we can afford to invest in work that only pays off in the long term, and do not need to focus solely on delivering features

nodes.id: More product surface = more feedback loops
nodes.name: More product surface = more feedback loops
To win is to promote sustainable, scalable, adaptive, compounding positive-sum interactions for humanity. To win is to build an engine of plenty.
Tripling the speed at which our customers reach scale is one of the four things that, if they are all achieved, will get us to $100m ARR.
Tripling our customers' average fleet size is one of the four things that, if they are all achieved, will get us to $100m ARR.
Increasing our number of paying customers 10x is one of the four things that, if they are all achieved, will get us to $100m ARR
Doubling the average revenue we generate from each chargeable device is one of the four things that, if they are all achieved, will get us to $100m ARR
